meanings.sent1: The conflict between the siblings was about who gets to play with the toy first.
meanings.sent2: The conflict at the meeting was resolved through open communication.
meanings.sent3: The conflict over the last piece of cake led to a hilarious food fight.
meanings.sent4: The conflict in the classroom was a storm brewing between the students.
meanings.sent5: The conflict between the two characters made the story more exciting.

meanings.sent1: The country faced a long conflict that lasted for years.
meanings.sent2: The conflict between the two nations resulted in casualties.
meanings.sent3: The conflict in the movie turned into an epic battle scene.
meanings.sent4: The conflict in the story symbolized the fight for freedom.
meanings.sent5: The conflict depicted in the painting showed the horrors of war.

meanings.definition: Be incompatible or at variance; clash.
meanings.sent1: His busy schedule will conflict with his plans for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The colors of the two paintings conflict with each other.
meanings.sent3: The flavors in the dish conflict in a strange but tasty way.
meanings.sent4: Their opinions on the matter conflict like thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: The loud music will conflict with the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
